title: Constraint-Based Approach for Intensive Swimming Skill Learning

context.prior_knowledge: Basic swimming techniques (breathing, kicking, and primary strokes)
context.additional_context: Utilizes smartphone-based real-time video classes and video feedback.

learning_goals: Learners increase swimming stroke length by 15% through exploratory training strategies utilizing constraints
Learners enhance rhythm regulation skills using metaphoric tools (metronome)
Learners demonstrate the ability to identify functional movement domains related to tasks (e.g., optimizing torso tilt while swimming)

constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
